page.title: 08Primary School - Kirton
page.content: Kirton has a large primary school which was built in 1974, the official opening took place on March 25th 1975.The new building replaced the old all-age school which had opened in 1880. Children come to our school when they are 5years old and stay until they are 11years old.Many come by bus and car from country-side round Kirton and most children bring their lunch to school. There are over 4OO pupils at our school and 15 teachers including our Headteacher Mr. G.K. Ball. We have a swimming pool and a large playing field, also lots of lawns and gardens round school. Our school uniform is blue and grey and our badge has a sheaf of corn on it because we are a country school.
